title: Tuza's Conjecture is Asymptotically Tight for Dense Graphs
main_result: Tuza bound tau/nu <= 2 is asymptotically tight for dense graphs

lemmas.name: tuza_asymptotically_tight
lemmas.statement: theorem tuza_asymptotically_tight : ∀ ε > 0, ∃ G : SimpleGraph V, (triangleCoveringNumber G : ℚ) / trianglePackingNumber G > 2 - ε
lemmas.english: For any epsilon > 0, there exist graphs with tau/nu > 2 - epsilon
implications: Tuza's bound cannot be improved to tau <= (2-epsilon)*nu

lemmas.name: dense_graph_ratio_limit
lemmas.statement: lemma dense_graph_ratio_limit : For dense graphs, tau/nu approaches 2 as |V| → ∞
lemmas.english: Dense graphs have tau/nu ratio approaching 2
implications: Dense nu=4 graphs are GOOD for Tuza - they approach the bound

key_insight: Dense graphs approach tau = 2*nu asymptotically. This means: if a nu=4 counterexample exists, it must be SPARSE and structured, not dense.
implications_for_nu4: Dense nu=4 graphs satisfy Tuza (approach limit, don't exceed it)
notes: This is GOOD news - tells us where NOT to look for counterexamples
